title: FC Seoul in Asian football
text:
<a href="FC%20Seoul">FC Seoul</a> is a South Korean professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Seoul">Seoul</a>, <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>, who currently play in the <a href="K%20League%20Classic">K League Classic</a>. FC Seoul's first participation in Asian competition was during the <a href="K-League%201986">1986 season</a>, when they competed in the <a href="1986%E2%80%9387%20Asian%20Club%20Championship">Asian Club Championship</a>, their first match was against of <a href="Macau">Macau</a>, but FC Seoul withdrew. FC Seoul's next participation in Asian competition was <a href="1999%E2%80%932000%20Asian%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">1999–2000 Asian Cup Winners' Cup</a> and actual first match was <a href="Shimizu%20S-Pulse">Shimizu S-Pulse</a> of <a href="Japan">Japan</a>.
FC Seoul haven't won the Asia Champions League not yet, only have runners-up one time. Their most recent participation in the competition was in <a href="AFC%20Champions%20League%202011">2011</a>.
